Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Idayathavanai, PHC Sueandai, HSC Meenakshipuram Block Keelapavoor. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 Water samples send to Water Lab, Tirunelveli and 7 blood samples send to DPHL, Tenkasi for Dengue, Chikungunya, Lepto and 7 blood samples send to IVCZ, Hosur for Scrub Typhus test. Mass cleaning and fogging done in the affected village .Bleaching powder and lime powder mixture (in 1:3 ratio) sprayed in the damp and moist surfaces and in the cattle sheds. Fever camp established and sent patients to nearby PHC for inpatient care . Strict instructions to maintain Chlorination at 2 ppm. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village 'Athoor, SC 'Old Sempatti, PHC Sithayankottai, Block Athoor. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 14 smear samples were negative for Malaria at Sithayankottai PHC. 08 serum samples sent to DPHL, Dindigul;03 samples were positive for Leptospirosis. Water pipeline leakages were rectified and cattle shed was disinfected. Health camp organized in the school and all cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

house Dindigul; Leptospirosis.(IgM organized symptomatically. Health measures.Cases of fever reported from Village 'Viralipatti, HSC/PHC S.Thummalapatti, Block Nilakottai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to fever survey done. 18 smear samples tested at S.Thummalapatti PHC were negative for Malaria. 07 serum samples sent to DPHL 01 sample positive for Elisa) Health camp in the school and cases treated education given on personal hygiene and environmental sanitation

Cases of fever reported from Village 'Melachinnampatti, SC Kondayampatti, PHC Ayyankottai, Block 'Alanganallur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 05 serum samples sent to DPHL Madurai; 1 sample positive for Leptospirosis IgM Elisa. All cases treated symptomatically. Mass cleaning and disinfection done. Community advised to drink boiled water and disinfect cattle sheds. All breeding sources identified and destroyed.

Cases of fever with jaundice reported from Village Nerur, SC Nerur No. 01. PHC Walaval, Taluk Kudal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 02 blood samples tested for Malaria at PHC were negative. 14 blood samples tested; 04 positive for Leptospirosis by IgM Elisa. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given on personal hygiene measures and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Marlap Bituli, Bamunkhat, Sonapurpathar, SC Bandorgog, Ghogua, PHC Nartap, Digaru. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Two serum samples sent to DPHL Sonapur for IgM Elisa for Leptospirosis and were reported positive. Health camp organized in the school and cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases reported from multiple flood affected districts. Ernakulam, Alappuha, Pathanmthitta, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram and Kozhikode. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 158 cases confirmed using IgM ELISA for Leptospirosis at DPHL, Medical college and referral labs. All cases treated symptomatically. Intensive preventive measures implemented. Arrangements made for early recognition and treatment. Chemo prophylaxis using Doxycyclin capsules given to all persons exposed to flood water and those engaged in rescue works. Community made aware of signs and symptoms of disease and measures of prevention.

Cases reported from Village – Vengaivayal, HSC – Muthukadu, PHC - Cauvery Nagar, Block – Annavasal, District- Pudukkottai with fever. Six serum sample and one water sample sent to DPHL, Aranthangi where three samples tested positive for leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District & block RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education given through community sensitization meeting.

Cases reported from Village Habibullah Khan, SD-Bisalpur with fever, bodyache and fatigue. 58 sample tested for leptospirosis, out of which eight samples found positive by IgM ELISA. District & block RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education given.

Cases reported from Bhurbandha, Udari SD, Nabheti with symptoms of fever with jaundice. One serum sample sent to Microbiology deptt GMCH for Leptospirosis IgM ELISA, where it tested positive for it. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever survey conducted in the affected area. Health education was imparted.

Cases reported from Bhurbandha, Udari SD, Nabheti with symptoms of fever with jaundice. One serum sample sent to Microbiology deptt GMCH for Leptospirosis IgM ELISA, where it tested positive for it. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever survey conducted in the affected area. Health education was imparted.

Cases reported from Village Navoor, PHC/CHC Indabettu, Taluk Belthangady, District Dakshin Kannada. Case presented with vomiting, abdominal pain, fever and cough. One blood sample was sent to DPHL, Dakshin Kannada and tested IgM ELISA positive for Leptospirosis. The deceased case was a 23 years old male. The cause of death was septic shock with multi organ dysfunction syndrome. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever survey was done in the community. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Health Facility Pali, Block Sudhagad, district Raigad. They presented with fever with cough and cold. 20 blood samples were collected. Of these, one was found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Most of the affected cases belonged to 26-40 years age group. The deceased case was a 50 years old male. Examination of all the fever cases were done. Fever survey in the affected area was done. Health education was given on the importance of wearing footwear when going out and on rodent control measures.

Cases reported from Village Pervaje, PHC Bellare, Taluk Sullia, District Dakshina Kannada. Case presented with fever and pain in the abdomen. District RRT investigated the outbreak. The affected case was 59 years old male. One blood serum sent to DPHL Dakshin Kannada, result positive for Leptospirosis IgM ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team regarding the preventive measures. Case has succumbed to death on 30.04.2023.

Cases were reported from Jupiter hospital, Sub- District: Ulhasnagar, District: Thane. Case presented with fever, hypotension. 1 sample was sent to lab of Jupiter Hospital Thane, which was found to be positive for Leptospirosis PCR. 14 days house to house fever surveillance were conducted. Blood samples of the 4 relatives of suspected deceased patient were taken, which were found to be negative. The case a 70 year old female died due to multiple organ failure and viral pneumonia on 15/08/2023.

Cases were reported from Village Krishna Nagar, Sub-District Sandur, District Ballari. Cases presented with fever, headache and myalgia. 5 blood samples sent to VIMS Ballari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. 2 samples came positive for Leptospirosis IgM by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Valgalli Village, Santheguli PHC, Kumta Taluk. Cases presented with symptoms of fever & jaundice. Three samples were sent to DSL Uttara Kannada, out pof which 1 was found to be positive for Leptospira IgM by ELISA. District

Cases reported from Narmadapuram, Village Kotlakhedi, Ward no. 6, Block Seoni-Malwa. Cases presented with symptoms of fever & body ache. Total 8 blood and serum samples were collected & sent to AIIMS Virology lab, Bhopal, out of which 1 was found to be positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on hygiene, and sanitation. Health education imparted regarding the spread of disease. Active fever surveillance was done. IEC regarding Do's & Don’ts of Leptospirosis was done. House to house survey was done. Anti-larva activities were carried out.

Cases were reported from Village Ayan Karisalkulam, Sub-District Watrap, District: Virudhunagar. Cases presented with fever, headache and vomiting. 7 serum samples and were collected and sent to DPHL Virudhnagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age Group of the affected cases were 3-19 years. Cases were treated with antibiotics and other supportive measures. 3 samples found positive for Leptospirosis IgM by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on rodent control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of Fever reported from VillageThirumal HSC /PHC Koodakoil Block Kalligudi, District Madurai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey in the affected area done. 04 out of 05 blood samples tested at DPHL Madurai were found to be positive for Leptospirosis. All 42 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Gurumalai, Block Kayathat, PHC Kadambur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 15 Serum samples sent to DPHL out of which 07 samples were found to be positive for Leptospirosis and 10 samples WIDAL positive. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Sathamangalam, HSC Erakudi, PHC Keelapalur, Block Thirumanur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 serum samples sent to DPHL Ariyalur, 2 samples positives for Leptospirosis. Fever survey done. Indoor and outdoor fogging done. Mass Cleaning done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Nachalur, symptomatically. Health education given.Cases reported from Village/SC Nallur, PHC Block Kulithalai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 10 serum samples sent to DPHL Karur; 5 samples were positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. IEC also given. All cases treated

Cases reported from Village/SC Chinnamalaipatty, PHC Sengal, Block Krishnarayapuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 8 serum samples collected and sent to DPHL Karur, 1 sample was positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kalanjoor, HSC Edathara, PHC Koodal, Block Enadimangalam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done.3 blood samples taken and sent to General Hospital, PTA and all tested positive. Water samples taken for bacteriological and chemical analysis (results awaited). Well chlorination done in the area. Health education regarding personal and environmental hygiene, control of water borne diseases and other communicable diseases given.

Cases reported from Village Ponganad, HSC Nil, PHC/Block Kilimanoor. District RRT investigated the outbreak. It was observed that around 50 children were being given swimming training in village pond by some private agency. All 03 affected had history of going to this pond. They developed fever and body ache. 3 blood samples taken and all found positive for Leptospirosis by Ig M ELISA. Panchayat was alerted and people asked not to take a dip in the pond. Pond cleaning started.

Cases reported from Hill Area, Village/HSC Patchalur, PHC Poolathur, Block Palani. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 5 serum samples sent to DPHL Dindigul, 2 positive for Leptospirosis. Water samples collected from well and overhead tank and sent to DPHL, result awaited. Chlorination work is monitored for all drinking water sources. Mass cleaning campaign conducted. All cases treated.

Cases reported Kannivadi, Block Reddiarchatram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 15 blood smear collected were negative for malaria. Out of 5 serum samples collected; 3 samples were positive ELISA). All Health education given.casesfrom Village/SC Adalur, PHC for Leptospirosis treated(IGM symptomatically.

Cases reported from Village K.Nangupatti (Keela seethakudipatti, Mela Seethakudipatti), HSC Maruthampatti, PHC Neerpalani, Block Viralimalai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 4 water samples sent to Water lab, Trichy. 15 serum samples sent to DPHL, Aranthangi and 7 found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. Health camp organized in the area. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chandali Pada, SC Shrigaon, PHC Satpati, Block Palghar; Village Patilpada, SC Dehane, PHC Chandranagar, Block Dahanu. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 06 serum samples collected and sent to J.J Hospital; result awaited. Two death occurred in 33yr and 40yr old male. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Deva Pradi, Moti Daman and Dalwada, Nani Daman. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to House survey done. Out of 114 serum samples collected and sent o DPHL Daman, 7 samples were positive for Leptspirosis (IgM ELISA). Two death occurred in 50y/M and 22y/M. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Veliyathur, HSC Thatchamalli, PHC Ponbethi, Block Avudaiyarkovil. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 05 samples collected and sent to DPHL, Pudukottai; 02 samples were positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. All cases were treated symptomatically. Medical camp conducted in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Asniye, PHC Talkat, Block Dodamarg. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 07 serum samples collected; 05 were positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA and 02 were positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chintupada, SC Mahim, PHC Kelwa Mahim, Block Palghar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 serum samples collected was positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). One death occurred in 49 yr old male. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Harwada, Taluk Ankola. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 blood sample collected and sent to KMC Manipal; was found positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Muthalamada, SC Thoonakkadavu, PHC Parambikulam, Block Koduvayur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Artificial pond construction activities was undertaken by workers and tribal community. Out of 55 blood samples collected; 06 samples were positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). One death occurred in 48yr old male. All cases treated symptomatically. Doxy prophylaxis were given to all the workers engaged in pond cleaning activities/ marshy land activities. Awareness on Leptospirosis given to the tribes & forest staffs. Health education given.

Case reported from Kokisare Guravwadi Nivati Medha & Kalvi, Bhandargaon, Shivdav (Otoswadi)SC Kokisare, Nivati & Kochara, Vajrat PHC Vaibhavwadi, Parule, Adeli, Kalsuli,. Taluk Vaibhavwadi, Vengurla, Kankavil. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey conducted. The deceased were a 19y/M, 50y/M, 36y/M. 35y/F and 30y/M. A total of 25 blood samples collected and tested at DH, Sindhudurg; 07 were positive for Leptospirosis. Entomological survey revealed HI 3.8, CI -0.7 and BI 7.6. Doxcycline tablets distributed as chemoprophylaxis in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SC Periyur. PHC Poolathur, Block Kodaikanal, District Dindigul. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Mass fever survey done by paramedical team. Cases treated locally. Out of 6 serum samples collected and sent to ZET Dindigul, 1 sample was positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Cases of nausea, giddiness, jaundice, dark coloured urine reported from Village/SC Veluk, PHC Shiroshi, Block Murbad, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated. Out of 5 serum samples collected & sent to JJ Hospital Mumbai, 1 sample was positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). Control measures taken. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Kadampur (Ward no.12 &13), Block Pandanad, District Alappuzha. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Affected cases were labourers. Cases treated locally. 3 serum samples collected which tested positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). Control measures undertaken. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Kansur, Tyagalli, SC Kandur, PHC Siddapur, District Uttara kannada. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at local health centre. Out of 18 serum samples collected, 11 samples were positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA).

Cases reported from Village Jambulkheda, SC Talegaon, PHC Deulgaon, Block Kurkheda, District Gadchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at local health centre. All 14 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. 8 serum samples collected out of which 4 samples were positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA).

Cases of fever, joint pain, neck swelling and myalgia reported from Village P.Kombaipatti, SC K.Ayyapatti, PHC Gopalpatti, Block Sanarpatti, District Dindigul. District RRT investigated the outbreak Active search for fever cases done. All 20 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Out of 6 serum samples collected, 2 samples were positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). IEC done.

Cases of fever, headache, myalgia, nausea, vomiting, and calf muscles pain were reported from Village /SC T.Vellure, PHC Malmanjanur, Block/ District Thiruvannmalai. District RRT visited the affected area. Medical team deployed. Door to door surveillance done. All Cases treated. Anti-larval work carried out. Fogging done. 24 Blood slides were tested for malarial parasite, all were found negative. 5 serum samples sent to IVCZ Hosur, out of which 4 are positive for Leptospirosis, & 1 positive for chikungunya.

Cases reported from Gandhi Nagar, SC Nerupur, PHC Eriyur, Block Pennagarm, District Dharmapuri. RRT investigated the outbreak. There were poor sanitary conditions in the affected area. OHT were not chlorinated. Entomological survey revealed following results- HI 15%, CI 0.5%, BI 0.5%. 6 serum samples were collected & sent to IVCZ Hosur, out of which 3 were positive for Leptospirosis, 2 for Chikungunya & 1 for both Leptospirosis & Chikungunya. Anti larval work was done. Fogging done. Solid waste management undertaken. Regular fever survey done. IEC activities regarding water storage & mosquito breeding done.

Cases reported from Village and SC Keelaputhaneri, PHC Vallanad, District Thoothukudi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 15 blood smears collected which tested negative for malaria. Out of the 6 serum samples collected, 5 samples were positive for Leptospirosis and one for Dengue. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given regarding not to use contaminated water for drinking and bathing purposes. Capsule Doxycycline given both prophylactic and therapeutic dose to all affected persons.

Cases of fever, vomiting, diarrhoea, abdominal pain, yellow coloured urine reported from Village Mamundi Agraharam, SC Mamundi, PHC Palamedu, Block Mallasa udram, District Namakkal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Temporary medical camp organized. Cases treated locally. Out of 7 serum samples collected, 3 samples were positive for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). Chlorination of water sources done.

Cases reported from Village Panathady, PHC Madikkai, FHC Karindalam, Block Nileshwer, District Kasaragod. Cases were reported among paddy field workers. They presented with fever. 63 blood samples were collected and sent to RPH Lab Kannur. Out of these, 18 were found to be positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Symptomatic treatment was given. Doxycycline prophylaxis was given to all. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Panathady, PHC Madikkai, FHC Karindalam, Block Nileshwer, District Kasaragod. Cases were reported among paddy field workers. They presented with fever. 63 blood samples were collected and sent to RPH Lab Kannur. Out of these, 18 were found to be positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Symptomatic treatment was given. Doxycycline prophylaxis was given to all. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village/HWC Soru Radhaati, BPHC Dagaon, District Nagaon. Case presented with fever, malaise, chills and vomiting. Three Serum samples were collected and sent to DPHL, Nagaon. For bacteriological analysis. One serum sample out of three samples was found positive for Leptospira by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak and house to house survey was conducted. All cases were given symptomatic treatment Health education was given on the importance of safe drinking water and hand hygiene.

Cases reported from Village/HWC Soru Radhaati, BPHC Dagaon, District Nagaon. Case presented with fever, malaise, chills and vomiting. Three Serum samples were collected and sent to DPHL, Nagaon. For bacteriological analysis. One serum sample out of three samples was found positive for Leptospira by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak and house to house survey was conducted. All cases were given symptomatic treatment Health education was given on the importance of safe drinking water and hand hygiene.

Cases reported from TH Nileshwer FHC Karindalam, Choyyamcode Panathady, PHC Madikkai, FWC Madikkai, District- Kasaragode. District RRT investigated the case. 63 serum samples were collected and sent to RPH Lab, Kannur. Out of which 18 cases were found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. Active case search was done. Doxycycline prophylaxis was given, symptomatic treatment was given. Health education given.

Case reported from Central Jail, Jabalpur. The case presented with fever and bodyache. The deceased case was a 47 years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search was done. Doxycycline prophylaxis was given and symptomatic treatment was given. Health education given.

Cases reported from FHC Vamanapuram, FWC Venjaramoodu, Thottumpuram Ward, District Thiruvananthapuram. Cases were. MGNREGS workers who participated in cleaning a canal. They presented with headache, nausea, vomiting and fever. 20 blood samples were collected and sent to PH Lab. Of these, eight were found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search was done. Doxycycline prophylaxis was given and symptomatic treatment was given. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Rampurpam, SC Rampurpam, PHC Upper Doomdumia, BPHC Dhing, District Nagaon. Cases presented with fever. Five blood samples were collected and sent to GMCH, Guwahati and were found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. The deceased was a 91 years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search and mass fever survey was carried out. Doxycycline tablets were distributed. Health education was given regarding the importance of insecticide treated bed nets.

Cases reported from Village Topahula, HWC Hatimura, BPHC Jakhalabandha, District Nagaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Three blood samples were collected and sent to GMCH, Guwahati and were found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search and mass fever survey was carried out. Doxycycline tablets were distributed. Health education was given regarding the importance of insecticide treated bed nets.

Case reported from Belekeri Village, Taluk Ankola, District Uttar Kannada. Case presented with fever, malaise and headache. One blood sample was sent to KMC Manipal and tested positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 35 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search and mass fever survey was carried out. Health education was given regarding the importance of rodent control measures and proper disposal of wastes.

Case reported from Belekeri Village, Taluk Ankola, District Uttar Kannada. Case presented with fever, malaise and headache. One blood sample was sent to KMC Manipal and tested positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 35 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search and mass fever survey was carried out. Health education was given regarding the importance of rodent control measures and proper disposal of wastes.

Cases reported from Kodkani Village, Kumta Taluka, Uttar Kannada District. Case presented with headache, malaise, giddiness and weakness. One serum sample was sent to DSL Uttar Kannada and was positive for Leptospirosis. The deceased was a 57 year, Male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Conducted fever survey in the affected area.

Case reported from Bisalcoppa Village, SIRSI Taluka, Uttara Kannada. Case presented with fever and body pain. One blood sample was sent to Justice K.S. Hegde Charitable Hospital and was found positive for Leptospira by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 41 years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey was done in the affected area. Health education was given on the importance of rodent control measures.

Case reported from Belambar village, Belse PHC, Ankola Taluka, District Uttar Kannada. Presented with fever with chills from 08-09- 2022. One serum sample sent to DSL (Uttar Kannada) and it tested positive for leptospirosis by IgM antibody. The deceased was 35 year old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Fever survey was conducted in the affected area.

Case reported from Apsarakonda village, Honnavar Taluka, District Uttar Kannada. Case presented with fever for ten days. One serum sample sent to DPHL (Dakshin Kannada) and it tested IgM positive for leptospirosis. The deceased was a 38 year old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. House to house fever survey conducted. Super chlorination of drinking water source has been done.

Case reported from Taluk Kalaburagi, District Kalaburagi. with fever and generalised weakness. Six blood samples sent to DPHL Kalaburgi where one sample tested positive for Leptospirosis IgM District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Rodent control measures were taken.

Case reported from Kedila Village, Bantwal Taluka, Dakshin Kannda District. A 65 year old man was admitted to private hospital on 08-10-2022 with symptoms of fever, cough, chest pain, breathlessness and pedal oedema. One serum sample sent to Father Muller Medical College Hospital and tested IgM positive for leptospirosis. The patient expired on 13-10-22. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. The deceased’s family members and people in community were sensitized regarding the preventive measures. Fever Survey was done

Cases reported from Village Chaudhrana, District Fatehpur. Case presented with fever and bodyache. One blood sample was sent to KGMU, Lucknow and was tested positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Door to door survey was done. Health education was given on the importance of rodent control measures.

Case reported from Village Sirsi, PHC-CHC UPHC Sirsi, Taluk Sirsi, District Uttara Kannada. Case presented with fever and vomiting. One blood sample was sent to DPHL, Dakshin Kannada and was found positive for Leptospirosis by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 24 years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given on the importance of rodent control measures.

Case reported from Village Sarashwathi Nagara, PHC-CHC UFWC-3, Taluk Davangere, District Davangere with symptoms of fever and cough since one month. One blood sample collected and sent to Father Muller Institute of Medical Education And Research, Mangalore where it tested positive for leptospirosis. Case was also suffering from co-morbidities including liver disease. The deceased was a 37year male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village Sarashwathi Nagara, PHC-CHC UFWC-3, Taluk Davangere, District Davangere with symptoms of fever and cough since one month. One blood sample collected and sent to Father Muller Institute of Medical Education And Research, Mangalore where it tested positive for leptospirosis. Case was also suffering from co-morbidities including liver disease. The deceased was a 37year male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Suresh Nagara, PHC/CHC SMK Nagara, Taluk Davangere, District Davangere. Patient suffered from nausea, breathlessness and tachycardia. One sample collected and sent to Yenapoya Medical College Hospital, tested positive for leptospirosis. The deceased was a 28 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Sarve, Taluk Puttur, District Dakshina Kannada. Patient reported with symptoms of fever, cough, pain in the abdomen. One blood sample collected and sent to DPHL Dakshin Kannada, tested positive for leptospirosis. The deceased was a 57years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Suresh Nagara, PHC/CHC SMK Nagara, Taluk Davangere, District Davangere. Patient suffered from nausea, breathlessness and tachycardia. One sample collected and sent to Yenapoya Medical College Hospital, tested positive for leptospirosis. The deceased was a 28 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Sarve, Taluk Puttur, District Dakshina Kannada. Patient reported with symptoms of fever, cough, pain in the abdomen. One blood sample collected and sent to DPHL Dakshin Kannada, tested positive for leptospirosis. The deceased was a 57years old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from PO- Chinchoti, PHC- Revdanda, Taluka Alibag, District Raigad with symptoms of dyspnea, B/L leg swelling, Bodyache, Weakness etc. Total 28 Sample were sent to District Hospital Alibag Lab. for ELISA Test where two samples found positive. The decerased was Mr. Shankar Posu Patil, 90 year old male. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Rapid Fever Survey was conducted. IEC about not going to the field barefoot provided.

Cases reported from Cherthala Municipality area. District RRT investigated. 9 blood samples tested in Microbiology lab, Alappuzha; 1 tested IgM positive for Leptospirosis, 2 were negative, and result of 6 samples is awaited. Health camp held and house to house survey conducted. Local health authorities using doxycycline tab for prophylaxis of people at risk. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from CHC Edayazham, PHC Udayanapuram, Irumboozikara. All cases were working for the clearance of paddy fields under National Rural Self employment guarantee scheme. Cases reported had history of fever of 2-3 days duration. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Blood samples taken for serology and other investigation; result awaited. 11 cases admitted in CHC Vaikom are on treatment with antibiotics and other supportive measures. Others on prophylactic treatment are under surveillance. People working in the paddy fields have been advised to use gloves and boots as personal protective measures. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from CHC Edayazham, PHC Udayanapuram, Irumboozikara with history of fever 2-3 days duration. All were working for the clearance of pady fields under National Rural Self employment guarantee scheme. District RRT investigated the local outbreak situation. Blood samples taken for serology after 2 weeks; result awaited. IEC activities undertaken. 11 patients are admitted in CHC Vaikom are on treatment and other supportive measures. Others are under surveillance and on prophylactic treatment with doxycycline. Use of gloves and boots advised.

Outbreak reported from Irumboozikara, PHC Udayanapuram, CHC Edayazham. All cases were working in paddy fields under National Rural Self Employment Guarantee Scheme. Cases reported had history of fever of 2-3 days duration. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 out of 4 sera samples tested positive for IgM anti-Leptospirosis antibody by ELISA test. Other cases with similar symptoms are epidemiologically linked with positive cases. Cases admitted in CHC Vaikom are on treatment with antibiotics and other supportive measures. Others on prophylactic treatment are under surveillance. People working in the paddy fields have been advised to use gloves and boots as personal protective measures. IEC activities undertaken.

Cases with fever and jaundice reported from villages Chikamole, Hardhanahalli, Doddamole. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Three blood samples sent to NCDC branch Bangalore tested positive for Leptospirosis IgM ELISA. More fever cases found among children below 10 years. IEC activities undertaken. Health Assistants posted in the area for regular follow up.

Cases found in the Seventh Day Adventist Speech & Hearing School at Madhuvinalli. 3 blood samples collected for ELISA test found positive for Leptospirosis. District Rapid Response Team visited and investigated the affected area. Stagnant water bodies found in the area. Confirmed cases treated with antibiotics. Health education given to the local school authority and affected villagers regarding the preventive measures of Leptospirosis.

Outbreak reported from Shehu, Chole, Jhotirpada areas under PHC Gadab, Taluk Pen. District RRT visited the affected area. Sera samples tested positive for IgM Leptospirosis.House to house survey done for new cases. Water disinfection done regularly. Health education given regarding prevention and control measures.

Outbreak reported from Rave, Hamarapur, PHC Jite, Taluk Pen. District RRT visited the affected area. Sera samples tested positive for IgM Leptospirosis. House to house survey done. Water disinfection done. Health education given regarding prevention and control measures.

Outbreak reported from Vill Chichala, PHC Nagardhan, Taluka Ramtek. Out of 5 sera samples sent to B.J. Medical College, Pune, 2 samples tested positive for IgM Leptosporsis. Fever surveillance done in the area. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Pudupettai road, Tiruupattur, UHC & Block Tiruupattur, District Vellore. 4 serum samples sent to ZET Vellore, out of which 2 are positive for Leptospirosis & 1 positive for scrub typhus. Chlorination of water done.

Cases of fever reported from Village /HSC/PHC Periyapattinam, Block Tirppulani, District Ramnathapuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active survey done. All cases treated symptomatically.12 blood smears tested negative for malaria. Out 4 serum samples tested at DPHL, Ramnad, 2 samples positive for leptospirosis. Poor sanitation observed in the community. Health education given regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village South Kariyur, Sambai, PHC Rameswaram Urban, HSC Karaiyur, Block Mandapam, District Ramanathapuram. A total of 06 blood smear and 14 serum samples sent to DPHL Ramnad; 04 samples tested positive for Leptospirosis and 03 samples for Dengue. Anti larval work done. Out of 04 serum samples sent to ZET Virdhunagar; 02 samples found positive for Leptospira. House to house survey done. Source reduction done. Chlorination and disinfection done. Health education done regarding safe drinking water.

Cases reported from village Kirungakottai, PHC Piranmalai, Block Singampuneri, District Sivaganga. House to house survey done. Antilarval activities carried out. Fogging done. Health education done regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.
